body:

    Note that leaving sections blank will make it difficult for us to troubleshoot and we may have to close the issue.
-->


**Tell us about your environment**

<!--
    If you are using ESLint v6.5.0 or later, you can run ESLint with the `--env-info` flag and paste the output here.
-->

* **ESLint Version:** master (v7.5.0)
* **Node Version:** v12.14.0
* **npm Version:** v6.13.4

**What parser (default, Babel-ESLint, etc.) are you using?**

default

**Please show your full configuration:**

Linting ESLint's codebase, just added the following line to `rules` in [`.eslintrc.js`](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/f3a19d2a7ea9505000d14229a450dba133c10d5e/.eslintrc.js#L66):

```js
strict: ["error", "never"],
```

with this change, all files in our codebase will have a linting error (since they all have `"use strict"`) and thus all linting results will have `source` property.

**What did you do? Please include the actual source code causing the issue, as well as the command that you used to run ESLint.**

<!-- Paste the command you used to run ESLint: -->
```bash
npx eslint . --cache

npx eslint . --cache
```

**What did you expect to happen?**

Same cache size after the first and the second run.

**What actually happened? Please include the actual, raw output from ESLint.**

`.eslintcache` file size:

* First run ~380KB
* Second run ~10000KB (contains all source code) 

**Are you willing to submit a pull request to fix this bug?**

Yes.

By the comments in [lint-result-cache.js](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/f3a19d2a7ea9505000d14229a450dba133c10d5e/lib/cli-engine/lint-result-cache.js#L124) it seems the intention was not to store `result.source` in the cache file.

However, getting linting results from the cache [mutates](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/f3a19d2a7ea9505000d14229a450dba133c10d5e/lib/cli-engine/lint-result-cache.js#L90) cache objects that will be later saved on `reconcile`.
